bug.author: glw
bug.summary: possible file name typo in raspberry pi example
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/examples/tree/master/lite/examples/object_detection/raspberry_pi>https://github.com/tensorflow/examples/tree/master/lite/examples/object_detection/raspberry_pi</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
Near the bottom of the instruction on speeding up inference it reads python3 classify_picamera.py \ Based on the files in that example folder should that instead read python3 detect_picamera.py \ <denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
If my assumption above is incorrect, then its unclear where the file classify_pycamera.py is coming from, and should maybe be explicitly mentioned. <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
I didnt plan to since its possibly a simple typo. But I can if you'd like.

comments.comment: Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/glw>@glw</denchmark-link> , I'm sending a fix, but in the future remember that you can too. Github's edit button makes PRs for simple fixes like this with out leaving your browser.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> - ahh I wasnt aware of that. Thanks! I will do that for future minor issues.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> this issue seems to be solved.
